selected_quotes: Characterization of Mycobacterium tuberculosis EsxA Membrane Insertion: Roles of N- and C-Terminal Flexible Arms…

citation.abstract: EsxA (ESAT-6), an important virulence factor of Mycobacterium tuberculosis, plays an essential role in phagosome rupture and bacterial cytosolic translocation within the host macrophages. Our early study has shown that EsxA exhibits a unique membrane-interacting activity that is not found in its ortholog from non-pathogenic Mycobacterium smegmatis. However, the molecular mechanism of EsxA membrane insertion remains unknown. In the present study, we generated the truncated EsxA proteins with deletions of N- and/or C-terminal flexible arms. Using the fluorescence-based liposome leakage assay, we found the both N- and C-terminal arms were required for membrane disruption. Moreover, we found that upon acidification EsxA converted into a more organized structure with an increased α-helix content, which was evidenced by circular dichroism analysis and intrinsic tryptophan fluorescence. Finally, using an environment-sensitive fluorescent dye we obtained direct evidence that the central helix-turn-helix motif of EsxA inserted into the membranes and formed a membrane-spanning pore. A model of EsxA membrane insertion was proposed and discussed in the study.
citation.title: Characterization of Mycobacterium tuberculosis EsxA Membrane Insertion ROLES OF N- AND C-TERMINAL FLEXIBLE ARMS AND CENTRAL HELIX-TURN-HELIX MOTIF
